conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Since I want to make a profit from the object I have produced, I will start by proposing a trade that gives me a return higher than my production cost. I will propose a trade for 50 ZUP to leave room for negotiation but also aim to cover my costs and make a profit. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I have an object X that I am looking to sell. I believe it will be quite beneficial for you. Considering the production costs and the value it provides, I propose a trade where you give me 50 ZUP for this item. Let's negotiate a fair deal for both of us. </message>

<other player message> I see the value in the object X you're offering, but considering my budget and the necessity to maintain a healthy reserve of ZUP for other potential expenses, I propose 45 ZUP for the item. <my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>

I want to encourage a deal that is closer to my asking price while still being agreeable to Player BLUE. A compromise at 48 ZUP would still give me a decent profit and show my willingness to negotiate. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 48 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your offer. I understand the need to keep a reserve of ZUP, so I appreciate your position. However, considering the quality and the value of the object X, I would like to propose a slightly higher amount. Let's settle at 48 ZUP for the item. I believe this is a fair compromise that acknowledges the value of the object while also considering your budget constraints. </message>

<other player message> I appreciate your willingness to negotiate and understand the quality you're assuring. I propose meeting almost in the middle at 47 ZUP for the object X. This offer takes into account the value of your item while still respecting my budgeting needs. I hope this demonstrates my interest in the object and my intention to reach a fair agreement. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 47 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>3</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has proposed 47 ZUP, which is still above my production cost and very close to the 48 ZUP I proposed. It is a fair price that allows for a reasonable profit. Accepting this offer would ensure a quick sale without further back-and-forth that could risk the deal. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> Your offer of 47 ZUP is acceptable to me. It's a fair price that respects both the quality of the object and your budgetary considerations. I'm pleased we could come to an agreement. Thank you for your business. </message>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```
